User privilege level
One of the platform’s security features is the ability to differentiate user privilege levels.
For users with different privilege levels, it is possible to configure the separation of
password policies
and, through
auditing
, track actions performed within the system.
If the user’s privilege level cannot be determined or if all privilege levels have been deleted, no log will appear in the audit.
By default, there are "Administrator" and "User" levels.
New levels can be added in the registry of the "User privilege level" [SYS_SUBJ_PRIV_LEVEL] type.
The privilege level includes the following configuration parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Name of the user privilege level.
Order
Priority order of the configured privilege level.
The highest priority will be given to the level with the lowest order (0 means the highest priority).
Security policy
Assigning the
security policy
to the configured privilege level.
If no security policy is specified, the default policy will be used for the configured privilege level.
Security principals
Adding
users
and
access groups
to which the configured privilege level should be assigned.
If the user belongs to multiple access groups corresponding to different privilege levels, they will retain the highest available priority.
